abstracts.cdata!:
The potential adverse, environmental
            effects resulting from the implementation of the Greater
            Baku Water Supply Rehabilitation Project, and proposed
            mitigating measures, are addressed in this environmental
            management plan, which updates the environmental assessment
            prepared for the ongoing project, but focuses on the
            activities to be financed by the Supplemental Credit, as
            follows. Construction will generate air pollution, oil and
            fuel leakage, spoil, and construction debris: aboveground
            storage tanks, and drums will be stored on low permeably
            bases to contain oil spills; excavated spoil will be stored
            at selected sites, and should be covered to minimize dust
            emissions. Impacts on flora, and fauna may endanger
            ecological interest areas: to control soil erosion,
            construction sites will be stabilized by reseeding grass
            areas, while areas along coastal stream banks should be
            avoided, to stabilize soils, and provide wildlife habitats;
            hunting will be strictly forbidden. Civil works,
            particularly in urban areas, will disturb traffic: safety
            measures will be adopted, and traffic shall be rerouted as
            necessary, in the vicinity of construction areas, in
            accordance with international practices, enforced by local
            regulations. Cultural, and archaeological heritage sites
            shall be avoided, based on a preliminary survey, to be
            conducted by the archaeology, and antiquities institutes,
            while works should be monitored if unexpected archaeological
            sites are discovered.
